snippet: As interest has grown, attendance has reached the capacity of the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center, and organizers have added a series of preconvention events.
abstract: New York Comic Con introduces weeklong series of outside events known as Super Week; move is meant to address criticism of overcrowding at the Jacob K Javits Convention Center; event's 151,000 tickets sold out in mere hours for 2014 gathering, and revenue from ticket sales has increased 40 percent over 2013; some fans have begun to say that event has lost its focus.
lead_paragraph: As interest has grown, attendance has reached the capacity of the Jacob K. Javits Convention Center, and organizers have added a series of preconvention events.

headline.main: At New York Comic Con, Growing Pains Come With the Crowds
headline.print_headline: Growing Pains at Popular New York Comic Con
